Message.Title: Looks Ready to Triple Fast
Message.Msg: Concurrent (CCUR) has potential to triple in the short-term. Ericsson (ERIC) just announced they are paying Microsoft (MSFT) almost $200mm to acquire their Mediaroom multi-screen video software in order to increase their multi-screen video reach by 11mm pay-TV households to 16mm for a 25% multi-screen market share. CCUR's MediaHawk multi-screen video delivery platform is superior to Mediaroom and CCUR multi-screen deals already signed with the #1 largest cable TV companies in Germany, Japan, and the UK. CCUR's huge multi-screen clients have a total of 14.8 million subscribers, which will make CCUR #2 in this space behind ERIC. CCUR only has 8.72mm o/s and is trading for only $6.16 with a market cap of $53.715 million. CCUR has $24.6 million in cash, giving CCUR an enterprise value of only $29.115 million, which is less than half its annualized revenue of $66.4 million and only 3.5X its cash flow from operations over the last 3 quarters alone! CCUR's video business, which also has the #1 largest video-on-demand (VOD) market share with a global reach of 50mm households, is currently receiving zero value! CCUR spent $15 million to acquire their Media Data Intelligence (MDI) business, which tracks the viewing behavior of 35mm pay-TV subscribers for a 35% market share in its space. CCUR also owns a "real-time" high performance computer processor business that powers many simulator devices in the defense and aerospace industry. It has annualized revenue of $27.6 million with 4 of the top 5 defense contractors as clients. This business is most likely worth $25-$30 million by itself! CCUR's multi-screen video delivery business with $33.8 million in annualized revenue is currently receiving no value, when it could be worth anywhere from $50-$200 million! CCUR is very profitable with its EPS doubling the last two quarters straight! CCUR's dividend yield is a huge 3.9%, higher than all its competitors!

Topic.Title: I bought at $12.02 -- Yea!!

Message.Msg: My constant battle is how to increase my per day returns on investments. $1000 at 6% is only about $.16438 a day. If you put one dollar a day in an account - that would equate to $6,000 in an account drawing 6%. Banks are not paying 6%, therefore you would need to find someone who is, and that would be corporate bonds. You would want to buy corporate bonds which are paying that type of interests. I have bonds that I bought at $560 per bond a few years ago with a face value of $1000 drawing 6.22% on the $1000 which equates to about 9.70% on my original investment. When they pay off the bonds, I get the $1000 which is a 44% return on investment. That purchase alone pays me $4.09 a day. I have some bank corporate bonds paying over 8% which are tied to the PS. The bonds I own range from 3.5% to 8.25% and a number of them are step-up meaning they will increase in percentage over time if not paid off. My 3% stock holdings are there for tax purposes only. I am hoping they will cover most of the income taxes when I start pulling my IRA. My BAC stocks were purchased at $6.28 a share and will wait for $38 however long it takes.

Message.Title: Bullish Three Inside UP pattern is forming ------ BAC's going higher, hold on to your shares.
Message.Msg: The Bullish Three Inside Up Pattern is another name for the Confirmed Bullish Harami Pattern. The third day is confirmation of the bullish trend reversal.

Topic.Title: Bullish Three Inside UP pattern is forming ------ BAC's going higher, hold on to your shares.

Message.Msg: For Bullish Three Inside UP pattern definition. Recognition Criteria: 1. Market is characterized by downtrend. 2. We see a Bullish Harami Pattern in the first two days. 3. Then we see a white candlestick on the third day with a higher close than the second day. Explanation: The first two days of this pattern is simply the Bullish Harami Pattern, and the third day confirms the reversal suggested by the Bullish Harami Pattern, since it is a white candlestick closing with a new high for the last three days. Important Factors: The reliability of this pattern is very high, but still a confirmation in the form of a white candlestick with a higher close or a gap-up is suggested.

Next check comes on the 3rd, and he can go buy some liquor and smokes after he trades the balance on his EBT card. Then he'll be all better for a few days, too wasted to get on the bus to go to the library to use the free computer. After the money and booze is gone, all he's got is dreams of what he wants to be someday. Before this thought is banished to Siberia, I wonder if he would have to bend over to "completely take in the store", or would it just be shoved with some serious force, or would force even be necessary at all.
